Larry Page and Sergey are 10 years older than they were when they thoughtfully hired Eric Schmidt to be the CEO... so everybody's growing up, Vint Cerf said. Google has grown over the past decade from a start-up battling other Internet search engines into a technology giant with nearly 25,000 employees and annual revenue of nearly$ 30 billion. 2011, 22:16 EST Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. Quotes delayed, except where indicated otherwise. Delay times are 15 mins
